intro: Ononis thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine, white hairs. Its small, pink to white flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer. The leaves are opposite, linear, and often have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
